pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Maybe a little context would be helpful :)

I presume this is looking for review? Let me label it accordingly - if my guess was wrong, feel free to update that status.
With my reviewer's hat on, I wonder the same as Ruben: can you explain *why* you prefer this change? Once you've done so, feel free to mark `awaiting-review` again.

Let $V$ be a module over a ring $R$ and let $V^* = \text{Hom}_R(V, R)$. Choose $x, y \in V$ and $f, g \in V^*$ such that $f(x) = g(y) = 2$. Then we can define the reflections $r_1, r_2 \in GL(V)$ by $r_1(v) = v - f(v)x$ and $r_2(v) = v - g(v)y$ (see [Module.reflection](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Reflection.html#Module.reflection)).

One of the important ingredients to defining a *reflection representation* of a Coxeter group (see my comment at the bottom of #11526) is having some formula for the power $(r_1 r_2)^m$. That formula is:
$$(r_1 r_2)^m v = v - \frac{2 T_m(t/2) - 2}{t - 2} (f(v) x + g(v) y) + \frac{U_{m-1}(t/2) - U_{m-2} (t/2) - 1}{t - 2} g(x) f(v) y + \frac{U_{m}(t/2) - U_{m-1} (t/2) - 1}{t - 2} f(y) g(v) x$$
where $t = f(y) g(x) - 2$. This formula is messy, but it can be proved straightforwardly using induction. Also, all of the fractions in this formula are actually polynomials in $t$, so this formula works over any ring, which is important for defining crystallographic reflection representations.

However, actually stating this formula for $m = 0$ (which had better be possible, because that is the base case of the induction) requires defining $U_{-2}$ and $U_{-1}$. And I figured that if I'm going to do that, I might as well define $U_n$ and $T_n$ for every integer $n$.
Would it be easier to define `T (n : Int)` as `oldT n.natAbs`? Or just add a lemma about `oldT n.natAbs`?

No, it is not easier. I tried it. Instead of having two-way induction, everything would be a proof by cases. The amount of code would be comparable, but it would be less readable (in my opinion) and there would be an unnecessary function `oldT` lying around.

Also, you can't do the same thing with `U`. The best you can do is
`U R n = (oldU R ((n + 1).natAbs - 1)) * (n + 1).sign`, which is quite bad for doing any sort of proofs with.
Can you add the result linking your definition to the one @urkud suggests?
Thanks for the feedback; I'm now using a custom induction principle and I added the theorem about `T R n.natAbs`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9270437901/job/25503430123)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9270437901/job/25503430790)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9270437901/job/25503431499)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Isn't `ring_nf` the default?
The default is `ring1`, but this doesn't normalize the indices of `T R`

Possibly worth defining a custom induction principle to avoid dealing with `Int.negSucc` etc:
```
@[elab_as_elim]
theorem T.induct' (motive :   Prop)
  (zero : motive 0)
  (one : motive 1)
  (add_two :  (n : ), motive (n + 1)  motive n  motive (n + 2))
  (neg_add_one :  (n : ), motive (-n)  motive (-n + 1)  motive (-n - 1)) :
   (a : ), motive a :=
  T.induct R motive zero one add_two fun n hn hnm => by
    simpa only [Int.negSucc_eq, neg_add] using neg_add_one n hn hnm
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: index Chebyshev polynomials by integers instead of natural numbers

source.title: feat: the Chebyshev polynomials C and S

source.title: General geometric representations of a Coxeter group
